newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates softer amid slower money demand.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates softer amid slower money demand.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates were softer at midday on Monday as the early-month routine payroll demand was slower than expected, dealers said.
The overnight interbank rate was at 4.868 percent against Saturday's 4.956 close, with 30-day commercial paper at 4.75-4.80 against 4.85-4.90.
Dealers said they expected rates to fall further as no major money demand was expected this week, but instead T$15 billion worth of T-bills will mature on Saturday to fuel the market.
Bond yields fell slightly at midday, with the 10-year 84/1 at 5.6475-6500 against 5.6500-6600.
